response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Tile> it = tiles.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
if(it.next().drawingDone == false){
it.next().draw();
it.next().drawingDone = true;
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an iterator to iterate over a subset of the elements in the list. In your case, you can check if the current tile has been drawn or not and only call the draw method if it hasn't been drawn yet. This way, you can reduce the number of times the draw method is called and save memory.
